page.title: 07LLANSTEFFAN AREA: FARMING 1.
page.content: All 31 holdings are grassland livestock farms. Dairying, which was the major enterprise, has recently been replaced on some by beef and sheep. About half still have a dairy unit and many, particularly since milk quotas came in, have secondary beef and/or sheep. Some augment their income by wintering "tack" sheep from the uplands. Size varies from less than 30 to 240 acres with half being under 60 acres and most of the remainder averaging 190 acres. Some farms have increased considerably from their original size by aquiring extra land as farms are split up and sold. 3 farmers are retired, their land being let to neighbours. Nine of the farms are tenanted, the remainder being family owned and run. Little outside labour is employed except at silage and hay harvest.
